message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of recursively recovering a time sequence of sparse signals in the presence of large but spatially correlated noise, which is a common problem in video surveillance and other applications. This involves solving a noisy compressive sensing (CS) problem and utilizing the correlation of the outliers to our advantage. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Other possible sub-categories include cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.NA (Numerical Analysis), and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as the paper also discusses the use of a Kalman filter (or any adaptive filter) to update the correlation model parameters.
